1.title: Episode #5.1
1.plot: Robert interviews Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn, newly-appointed Culture Secretary Matthew Hancock and actress Miriam Margolyes in 2018's first edition of the show.

2.title: Episode #5.2
2.plot: Embattled UKIP leader Henry Bolton, CBI director-general Carolyn Fairbairn and Chief Secretary to the Treasury Elizabeth Truss are Robert's guests this week.

3.title: Episode #5.3
3.plot: Jacob Rees-Mogg, Gina Miller, Baroness Evans and Nish Kumar are Robert's guests. With analysis and comment from MP's Nadine Dorries and Kate Hoey.

4.title: Episode #5.4
4.plot: Katie Price talks to Robert about the trolling of her disabled son and her campaign to change the law. Housing Minister Dominic Raab, Gus O'Donnell and Shami Chakrabarti are among the other guests.

5.title: Episode #5.5
5.plot: Robert speaks to Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell, Justice Minister David Gauke and Irish senator Neale Richmond. With comment from Theresa Villiers and Alastair Campbell.

6.title: Episode #5.6
6.plot: Ruth Davidson, Shadow Foreign Secretary Emily Thornberry and Justine Greening are among the guests speaking to Robert on this week's show.

7.title: Episode #5.7
7.plot: Robert interviews Leader of the House of Commons Andrea Leadsom, Labour Party Deputy Leader Tom Watson and the Democratic Unionist Party's Nigel Dodds.

8.title: Episode #5.8
8.plot: Robert speaks to Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, Liberal Democrat leader Vince Cable and Cabinet Office Minister David Lidington. With analysis from MPs Caroline Flint and Sarah Wollaston.

9.title: Episode #5.9
9.plot: Chancellor Philip Hammond and Shadow Business Secretary Rebecca Long-Bailey discuss the Spring Statement, American trade tariffs and the poisoning of a former Russian spy in Salisbury.

10.title: Episode #5.10
10.plot: The poisoning of former Russian spy Sergei Skripal in Salisbury dominates the discussion this week. Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell discusses the Spring Statement.

11.title: Episode #5.11
11.plot: Brexit, the sacking of Owen Smith, extra funding for the NHS, data protection and the reaction from around the world to the poisoning in Salisbury are among the topics discussed by Robert and his guests.

12.title: Episode #5.12
12.plot: The airstrikes against Syria dominate discussion as Robert speaks to David Lidington, Emily Thornberry, Patricia Scotland and Caroline Lucas.

13.title: Episode #5.13
13.plot: Robert discusses the Windrush deportation scandal with John McDonnell and Sayeeda Warsi. He also discusses antisemitism in the Labour Party with actress Maureen Lipman.

14.title: Episode #5.14
14.plot: The announcement of the date for Donald Trump's state visit to the UK is one the main talking points this week as are mounting problems for Home Secretary Amber Rudd.

15.title: Episode #5.15
15.plot: Robert discusses the local election results, the resignation of Home Secretary Amber Rudd, open revolt against party leaders, transgender rights and medical discrimination against the elderly with his guests.

16.title: Episode #5.16
16.plot: Robert speaks to Israeli Ambassador Mark Regev, Leader of the House of Lords Natalie Evans and Shadow Business Secretary Rebecca Long-Bailey. With tributes to the late Tessa Jowell.

17.title: Episode #5.17
17.plot: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, trade union leader Len McCluskey and business leader Paul Drechsler are among the guests discussing everything from the royal wedding to internet trolls.

18.title: Episode #5.18
18.plot: The people of the Republic of Ireland have voted to liberalise abortion laws leaving Northern Ireland's abortion laws as an aberration. How can the British Government respond?

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: In the first edition of this new, live, interactive political chat-show Robert Peston interviews Chancellor George Osborne and documentary film-maker Louis Theroux. With Allegra Stratton.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn and UKIP leader Nigel Farage are among the guests joining Robert Peston. MP's Liz Kendall and Jacob Rees-Mogg also feature.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Prime Minister David Cameron, comedian David Baddiel, singer Lily Allen, Ed Balls and Esther McVey are the guests of Robert Peston for live Sunday morning political discussion.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: London Mayor Sadiq Khan, former Work and Pensions minister Iain Duncan Smith and artist Alison Jackson are Robert's guests. With Nadine Dorries and former spin doctor Tom Baldwin.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: The leave campaign's Michael Gove, model Lily Cole and author and journalist Henry Winter are Robert's guests. With analysis from Harriet Harman, James Cleverly and Allegra Stratton.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell, comedian Omid Djalili, Scottish Conservative leader Ruth Davidson and Suzanne Evans are Robert's studio guests. Julian Assange is interviewed via video link.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Chancellor George Osborne and UKIP leader Nigel Farage are Robert's guests. With contributions from MPs Yvette Cooper and Penny Mordaunt and political guru Steve Hilton.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Heidi Alexander explains her decision to resign as Shadow Health Secretary. Nicola Sturgeon outlines her plans in the wake of the Brexit vote and Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond is interviewed.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Robert talks to Tory leadership candidates Theresa May and Stephen Crabb, and Shadow Foreign Secretary and Corbyn loyalist Emily Thornberry. With analysis from Nicky Morgan and Tom Baldwin.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Labour leadership candidate Angela Eagle and Andrea Leadsom's most high-profile supporter Iain Duncan Smith are among the guests. Also featuring Alex Salmond, Hugh Dennis, Ed Balls and Baroness Warsi.

1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: ITV's Sunday morning political discussion show returns with interviews with Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, ahead of the party leadership election and comedian Matt Forde, ahead of the launch of his new TV show.

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Labour MPs John McDonnell, Yvette Cooper and Tristram Hunt discuss the result of the Labour Party leadership contest. Impressionist Jon Culshaw and Esther McVey of the Conservative Party are the other guests.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: This week's edition of the show comes from Birmingham, which is hosting the Conservative Party conference. Guests include Transport Minister Chris Grayling, explorer Sir Ranulph Fiennes and impressionist Jan Ravens.

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Education Secretary Justine Greening, newly-appointed Shadow Attorney General Shami Chakrabarti, comedian Bill Bailey and the "spin twins" Alastair Campbell and Sir Craig Oliver are Robert's guests.

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: Ventriloquist Nina Conti and her puppet Monkey get Robert into trouble. Other guests include Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, Trade Minister Greg Hands, entrepreneur Rohan Silva and MPs Andrew Mitchell and Gisela Stuart.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: UKIP's temporary leader Nigel Farage, Labour's Angela Eagle and comedian Andy Hamilton are among the guests interviewed by Robert Peston. With comment and analysis from MPs Jess Phillips and Kwasi Kwarteng.

7.title: Episode #2.7
7.plot: Former Deputy Prime Minister and Liberal Democrat Leader Nick Clegg, Labour's Brexit Secretary Keir Starmer, Employment Minister Damian Hinds and comedian Adil Ray are Robert's guests. With Liz Kendall and Nadine Dorries.

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: Robert Peston talks to the Leader of the House of Commons, David Lidington. The youngest MP in the Commons, Mhairi Black. Oxford University Chancellor, Lord Patten and a panel of guests to discuss the US Presidential Election.

9.title: Episode #2.9
9.plot: Robert speaks to Ed Miliband, UKIP leadership contender Suzanne Evans, RBS boss Sir Howard Davies and comedian Stewart Lee. With Ed Balls, Esther McVey and Jan Halper-Hayes.

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: Robert interviews Chancellor Philip Hammond ahead of his first Autumn Statement. Plus, U.S. Ambassador Matthew Barzun, TV presenter Alexander Armstrong and Shadow Business Secretary Clive Lewis.

11.title: Episode #2.11
11.plot: In the penultimate edition of 2016, Robert interviews Work and Pensions Secretary Damian Green, Trevor Noah, comedian Josh Widdicombe and TUC General Secretary Frances O'Grady.

12.title: Episode #2.12
12.plot: In the final edition of 2016, Robert interviews Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson about everything from Brexit to cake. BT Chairman Sir Mike Rake is quizzed on recent problems at the telecommunications giant.

1.title: Episode #3.1
1.plot: Robert questions Shadow Foreign Secretary Emily Thornberry on party policies, Piers Morgan about Donald Trump and invites the head of the Royal College of GPs to respond to the PM's criticism.

2.title: Episode #3.2
2.plot: New UKIP leader Paul Nuttall discusses the forthcoming by-election in Stoke-on-Trent, Keir Starmer will try to explain Labour's Brexit strategy and Michael Gove talks about his meeting with Donald Trump.

3.title: Episode #3.3
3.plot: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, Wikileaks founder Julian Assange and comedian Ross Noble are Robert's guests. With analysis from Labour's Chuka Umunna and Tory Suella Braverman.

4.title: Episode #3.4
4.plot: Robert talks to Housing Minister Gavin Barwell, Caroline Lucas of the Green Party, actor Mark Gatiss and impressionist Rory Bremner. With Andrew Mitchell and Caroline Flint.

5.title: Episode #3.5
5.plot: Robert interviews Leader of the House David Lidington, Shami Chakrabarti, Lord Kerslake and comedian Stephen K. Amos. MPs Yvette Cooper and John Whittingdale provide analysis.

6.title: Episode #3.6
6.plot: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan, Prisons Minister Sam Gyimah and comedian Lucy Porter are among this week's guests. With analysis from MPs Liz Kendall and Sir Nicholas Soames.

7.title: Episode #3.7
7.plot: Home Secretary Amber Rudd, Labour's Deputy Leader Tom Watson and comedian Shappi Khorsandi are Robert's guests. With comment from Nadine Dorries and Tom Baldwin.

8.title: Episode #3.8
8.plot: Robert interviews Chancellor Philip Hammond, Shadow Business Secretary Rebecca Long-Bailey and Gina Miller - the woman who took on the Government over Brexit and won.

9.title: Episode #3.9
9.plot: Robert speaks to Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson and Tory grandee Michael Heseltine via video link. His other guests include the editor of Private Eye magazine Ian Hislop.

10.title: Episode #3.10
10.plot: Robert interviews Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon and Welsh Secretary Alun Cairns. Comedian Milton Jones sets out why he should be Prime Minister. With Nicky Morgan and Stephen Kinnock.

11.title: Episode #3.11
11.plot: The cut and thrust of British politics is overshadowed by the Westminster terrorist attack. Security Minister Ben Wallace will be discussing the attack. Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn is interviewed.

12.title: Episode #3.12
12.plot: As Britain prepares for a snap General Election, Robert speaks to Liberal Democrat leader Tim Farron, Conservatives Michael Gove and Damian Green and Labour's Liz Kendall.

13.title: Episode #3.13
13.plot: Robert Peston interviews Prime Minister Theresa May and Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell with analysis from former Downing Street advisors Alastair Campbell and Camilla Cavendish.

14.title: Episode #3.14
14.plot: Robert questions Jeremy Hunt about mental health, Emily Thornberry on Labour's economic policy and Nigel Farage on the collapse of the UKIP vote.

15.title: Episode #3.15
15.plot: Robert interviews Brexit Secretary David Davis, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon and Europol director Rob Wainwright.

16.title: Episode #3.16
16.plot: Boris Johnson, Green Party leader Caroline Lucas, Labour's trade secretary Barry Gardiner and actor Hugh Grant are Robert's guests.

17.title: Episode #3.17
17.plot: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, UKIP leader Paul Nuttall and Defence Secretary Sir Michael Fallon are Robert's guests.

18.title: Episode #3.18
18.plot: With London again hit by a terrorist attack and election campaigning suspended as a mark of respect there is a change in the line-up of guests talking to Robert. Includes live coverage of a statement by Prime Minister Theresa May.

19.title: Episode #3.19
19.plot: Robert speaks to a number of guests in the studio and via video-link to try and make sense of the results of the UK general election. With a hung parliament the Conservatives will need to negotiate with the DUP to get a working majority.

20.title: Episode #3.20
20.plot: The response to the Grenfell Tower fire dominates Robert's discussions with Jeremy Corbyn, Philip Hammond, Dr Sarah Wollaston, David Lammy and film-maker Nisha Parti.

21.title: Episode #3.21
21.plot: Robert's guests include Lib Dem leadership hopeful Sir Vince Cable, International Development Secretary Priti Patel and former Chairman of the Conservative Party Lord Patten.

1.title: Episode #4.1
1.plot: Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell and trade unionist Len McCluskey discuss Uber, Brexit, public sector pay, strike-action and the single market with Robert Peston in Brighton.

2.title: Episode #4.2
2.plot: The show comes from Manchester where Robert will be discussing the Prime Minister at the Conservative Party conference, potential strike action at Royal Mail and the 'Northern Powerhouse' with his guests.

3.title: Episode #4.3
3.plot: This edition of the show comes live from Glasgow, where Robert will be speaking to Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the Scottish Conservatives Ruth Davidson and author Salman Rushdie.

4.title: Episode #4.4
4.plot: Robert Peston and Allegra Stratton are joined by MP's Keir Starmer, Alok Sharma and Nicky Morgan to discuss Brexit, the PM, housing and junior doctors.

5.title: Episode #4.5
5.plot: Robert discusses the week in politics with International Trade Secretary Dr Liam Fox, former Labour leadership contender Yvette Cooper and satirist Armando Iannucci.

6.title: Episode #4.6
6.plot: Catalan independence, sexual harassment in Westminster and the workplace, prisons and Brexit will all be discussed when Robert Peston interviews a range of guests.

7.title: Episode #4.7
7.plot: Bank of England governor Mark Carney discusses the recent rise in interest rates with Robert. Transport Secretary Chris Grayling is among the other guests.

8.title: Episode #4.8
8.plot: Robert interviews Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond ahead of the Budget. Other guests include David Miliband and the Chinese Ambassador to the UK.

9.title: Episode #4.9
9.plot: Robert speaks to Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell via video-link, Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby and former England and Arsenal captain Tony Adams.

10.title: Episode #4.10
10.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.title: Peston on Sunday
plot: A new, live, interactive Sunday morning political magazine show featuring interviews, topical guests, satire and discussion. Hosted by ITV's new political editor, Robert Peston.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
